summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 26250, entitled "An Ordinance providing for the laying off, opening, extending and establishing of Central Place from Seventeenth Avenue Northwest to Twentieth Avenue Northwest, all in the City of Seattle, as a public street and highway; providing for the condemnation, appropriation, taking and damaging of land and other property necessary therefor; and providing that the payment for said improvement be made a special assessment upon the property specially benefited, in the manner provided by law," passed over the Mayor's veto January 30th, 1911, published February 4th, 1911.
